definition: Rehe, Qing dynasty province abolished in 1955 and divided among Hebei, Liaoning and Inner Mongolia/refers to the Qing imperial resort at Chengde/see also 避暑山莊|避暑山庄[bi4 shu3 shan1 zhuang1] (history)
to warm up/to heat up/hot (of weather)/heat/fervent

sentences.english: The Mongolian nationality was one of the main nationalities in Rehe area.
sentences.chinese: 蒙古族是热河地区主要民族之一。

sentences.english: In the northeast corner, located Qing spring, it is the famous Rehe spring.
sentences.chinese: 东北角有清泉，即著名的热河泉。

sentences.english: The former Rehe Province was one of the provinces where the I-Kuan Tao (the Unity Sect) ran rampant in the pro-liberation days.
sentences.chinese: 热河省是建国前一贯道活动最为猖獗的省份之一。

definition: Chahar Province (former province in North China existing from 1912-1936)
old name for district of Hohhot city 呼和浩特[Hu1 he2 hao4 te4], Inner Mongolia
historical name of Shenyang 瀋陽|沈阳 in modern Liaoning province
Shanhai Pass in Hebei, at the eastern terminus of the Ming dynasty Great Wall/Shanhaiguan district of Qinhuangdao city 秦皇島市|秦皇岛市[Qin2 huang2 dao3 shi4], Hebei
Ming and Qing dynasty province directly administered by Beijing, including Beijing, Tianjin, most of Hebei and Henan and part of Shandong
Peiping or Beiping (name of Beijing at different periods, esp. 1928-1949)
Uliastai, the Qing name for outer Mongolia
the three provinces of Northeast China, namely: Liaoning Province 遼寧省|辽宁省[Liao2 ning2 Sheng3], Jilin Province 吉林省[Ji2 lin2 Sheng3] and Heilongjiang Province 黑龍江省|黑龙江省[Hei1 long2 jiang1 Sheng3]
Tang Yulin (1871-1937), minor warlord in northeast China, sometime governor of Chengde 承德, mostly poor in battle but very successful at accumulating personal wealth
Manchou township in Pingtung County 屏東縣|屏东县[Ping2 dong1 Xian4], Taiwan
Eastern tombs/Dongling district of Shenyang city 瀋陽市|沈阳市, Liaoning
old name for Hohhot city 呼和浩特[Hu1 he2 hao4 te4], Inner Mongolia
the Qing court (as government of China)
Jinzhou prefecture-level city in Liaoning province 遼寧省|辽宁省 in northeast China
